kubensiri 146281483520 "2016-06-22 00:31:16 GMT" https://kubensiri.tumblr.com/post/146281483520/auttoton-breaaak-slimetony-slimetony "auttoton:  breaaak:  slimetony:  slimetony:  lets make a videogame how hard can it be  nevermind you have to know shit about computers  hey!! sorry to hijack this post
column2: but there are a bunch of ways you can make videogames without knowing shit about computers!!¬† for starters
column4: which is fucking great for making all kinds of interactive experiences (it‚Äôs what Crystal Warrior Ke$ha¬†was made in so you KNOW it‚Äôs good) at all skill levels (i picked it up and made a game in two minutes a few nights ago) if you want a bit more involved experience there‚Äôs Inform 7¬†which is a simple language for text-based adventure games that reads like slightly-weird English and also relatively easy to learn you can do some pretty fucking cool stuff with Unity¬†(my personal engine of choice) but you may need to dig a bit farther to get at the good stuff. there‚Äôs lots of really good presets though (i made an entire game just mixing and matching pre-existing templates and adding in my own art
column5: won an award at a game jam for that one) and if you want help the community‚Äôs pretty dang friendly from what i‚Äôve seen! this is just a taste of what‚Äôs out there from what i‚Äôve seen
column6: but there‚Äôs so many cool resources out there. if anyone wants help getting started
column7: i‚Äôm around to give you a leg up on making something in the coolest
column8: most unexplored art medium around!  I‚Äôm addin‚Äô¬†to this post because lowering the barrier to entry for making games is super important to me!!!! If y‚Äôall have any questions about making games
column9: you‚Äôre welcome to come and ask! I made this list a while back with some friends
column10: so it has some of the programs John already mentioned. 2D Editors: GameMaker : Potential for pure drag-and-drop ‚Äúprogramming‚Äù. It is recommended to read-up on the program‚Äôs functions to make good use of it. Good for prototyping. Uses its own language called Game Maker Language (GML) that is similar to a C language (e.g. C++ or C#). For both Mac and PC; free version available. Construct2 : Drag and drop level editor that uses an ‚ÄúIf-Then‚Äù event sheet structure for programming. Good for prototyping and for beginners. For PC; free version available. GameSalad : Drag and drop with no code requirement. Good for programming. For both Mac and PC; free version available. Solpeo : HTML5 based game engine for 2D and isometric game development. Some programming knowledge needed. Platforms supported: Chrome
column12: Internet Explorer 9+. Free version available. Stencyl : Drag and Drop ‚Äúprogramming
column13: ‚Äù templates you can edit the variables/values for. Scratch : Lego-block-style coding platform by MIT; totally free and a great intro to thinking in code. Very kid-friendly and comes with a community site. Browser version available. 3D Editors: Unity : 3D editor that creates 3D games. Can build games for browser
column15: or for mobile devices (iOS and Android). For both Mac and PC; free version available. UDK (Unreal Development Kit) : Full-fledged
column16: highly advanced editor. Features a complete set of tools that go from level design to visual scripting to cut-scene creation. Uses it‚Äôs own programming language called Unreal Script that can be arranged with Kismet
column17: a visual code editor. For Mac and PC; free. 2D Art/Animation Software: GIMP : Free photo editing and digital painting software. Easy Paint Tool SAI : Free digital painting software with a UI similar to Photoshop. Mischief : Free digital painting software with an endless canvas. 3D Art/Animation Software: Sculptris : From the company that created Zbrush
column18: this free software is ideal for beginning 3D sculptors. Maya : Animation
column21: and rendering software. Magical Voxel : Voxel Art (3D Pixel Art). Very intuitive and quick to pick up. SketchUp : ¬†Architectural modeling software
column22: great for creating 3D environments and buildings. Free version available. Text-Based Games: Twine : Create interactive text stories using Twine‚Äôs visual map system that links your game together. Easy to learn and use. End result is browser-based. For Mac and PC; free. Quest : Interactive text stories that you can build in-browser. Ren‚ÄôPy : Create visual novels using a modified version of Python that reads like a combination of stage directions and a CYOA novel. For PC
column24: and Linux; free. Audio Resources/Editors: Indie Game Music : This site offers free indie music with no need to worry about royalties or licenses. Audacity : A free
column26: cross-platform sound editor that allows you to record and arrange sound. Super Flash Bros. : This site allows you to record theremin-like (8bit) sounds and export them as .wav files for your games. FL Studio : Free music composition software. Miscellaneous Tools: Donjon RPG Tools : Randomly generates maps
column29: etc. W3Schools : Web-code tutorial database: HTML
column31: Javascript+. Debut Video Capture : Video screen capture to record Let‚Äôs Play videos
column33: etc. Korsakow : Free tool for creating interactive and database films. Processing : Flexible programming language used for visual and interactive artworks and simulations. From Student to Designer
column34: Part 2 : Tips for making a well-rounded
column35: solid portfolio Places to Publish/Share: Itch.io : Platform for self-publishing games Philome.la : Place to share Twine Games " False text

kubensiri 140581739630 "2016-03-06 19:37:48 GMT" https://kubensiri.tumblr.com/post/140581739630/star-ocean-5-details-and-screenshots-enemy-del "satoshi-mochida:  Square Enix has released new details and screenshots of Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness detailing a new enemy named Del Sur
column4: and more. Get the information below. ‚ñ† Characters Del Sur CV: Kazuya Nakai Gender: Male Age: 34 Weapon: Sword Origin: Kingdom of Trei‚Äôkur
column5: Planet Faykreed The brave general who leads the Trei‚Äôkur Army. He is a signeturgy swordsman who is skilled in the use of a sword
column6: but also specializes in fire-based attacks. He is brutal and a savage
column7: and will not hesitate to take the most vile means necessary to carry out what he must do. He does not hesitate when it comes to his vile behavior
column8: such as taking Relia hostage. When the King‚Äôs Chosen‚Äîthe group Victor belongs to‚Äîinvades East Trei‚Äôkur
column9: they do battle with Del Sur‚Ä¶ ‚ñ† Dungeons Trei‚Äôkur Execution Tower The Trei‚Äôkur Execution Tower is an execution site northwest of East Trei‚Äôkur. In the days of old
column10: the Trei‚Äôkur Army would execute criminals here
column11: but today it is used as a campsite for soldiers. Before heading to the Execution Tower
column12: the formidable foe Del Sur lies in wait. Mysterious Research Facility A vast research facility where technology was developed
column13: and where machinery and some sort of creatures inside glass-shaped tubes filled with liquid can be seen. What kind of research was going on using these creatures? Suspiciously-dressed soldiers and machine-type enemies block the way before you. ‚ñ† System Transporter The Transporter is a system that lets you warp to any location from the Charles D. Goale warp room. Since you can return back to the Charles D. Goale by using a transmission device
column14: you can move to faraway locations via the Charles D. Goale. ‚ñ† Battle System Advance Attack and Surprise Attack At the start of battle
column15: if you launch a preemptive attack before you‚Äôre noticed by enemies
column16: it‚Äôs called an ‚ÄúAdvance Attack.‚Äù On the contrary
column17: if you receive a preemptive attack from the enemy at the start of battle
column18: it‚Äôs called a ‚ÄúSurprise Attack.‚Äù Each has its own advantages and disadvantages in status effects. ‚ÄîAdvance Attack For a fixed period
column19: ATK and INT increase. ‚ÄîSurprise Attack For a fixed period
column20: DEF decreases. ‚ñ† Battle Miki‚Äôs Signeturgy ‚ÄîExplosion A fireball falls from above the enemy and causes a large explosion. The explosion wide range could result in a multiple-stage hit. ‚ÄîResurrection Revive allies who have fallen on the battlefield with all of their HP. ‚ÄîSunshine A multiple-stage hit attack that drops a number of light pillars from above the enemy. It also lowers the enemy‚Äôs INT. Anne‚Äôs Reserve Rush and Guard Counter ‚ÄîCanon Blaze (Reserve Rush) Anne flings up the enemy pulled down by the bottom of her palm and follows up with a wave of energy blasts. ‚ÄîMight Discharge (Guard Counter) Springs forth a ball of energy that blows enemies upward. When surrounded by enemies
column21: you can use this to escape or as a chance to land new combos. Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness is due out for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 3 in Japan on March 31
column22: and for PlayStation 4 in North America and Europe in 2016. In Japan
column23: the game will also be available in an ‚ÄúUltimate Box‚Äù edition. View the screenshots at the gallery. " False link

column1: kubensiri 136945859660 "2016-01-09 14:18:24 GMT" https://kubensiri.tumblr.com/post/136945859660/how-to-escape-after-being-buried-alive-in-a "freakology101: timesnewromney:  shickhard:  It could happen to anyone. People bury a person alive to scare them or to get rid of them. In this situation
column2: rely only on yourself. Do not waste oxygen. In a classic coffin there‚Äôs only enough oxygen for about an hour
column4: exhale very slowly. Once inhaled - do not swallow
column5: or you will start to hyperventilate. Do not light up lighters or matches
column6: they will waste oxygen. Using a flashlight is allowed. Screaming increases anxiety
column7: which causes increased heartbeat and therefore - waste of oxygen. So don‚Äôt scream. Shake up the lid with your hands. In some cheap low-quality coffins you will be able to even make a hole (with an engagement ring or a belt buckle.) Cross your arms over your chest
column8: holding onto your shoulders with your hands
column9: and pull the shirt off upward. Tie it in a knot above your head
column10: like so:¬†This will prevent you from suffocating when the dirt falls on your face.¬† Kick the lid with your legs. In some cheap coffins the lid is broken or damaged already after being buried
column11: due to the weight of the ground above it.¬† As soon as the lid breaks
column12: throw and move the dirt that falls through in the direction of your feet. When it takes up a lot of space
column13: try pressing the ground to the sides of the coffin with your legs and feet. Move around a bit.¬† Whatever you do - your main goal is to sit up: dirt will fill up the empty space and move to your advantage
column14: so no matter what - do not stop and try breathing steadily and calmly.¬† Get up. Remember: the dirt in the grave is very loose
column15: so battling your way up will be easier than it seems. It‚Äôs the other way around during a rainy weather however
column16: since water makes dirt heavy and sticky.¬†  JUST TO PROVE TUMBLR HAS A SURVIVAL GUIDE FOR FUCKING EVERYTHING.  just in case guys " False link
